content: see below across double_crochet in last st same as last cluster cluster stitch you will work this when you see work cluster yo insert hook in the same st as the last st made yo and pull up a loop yo and draw through 2 loops on hook yo skip next st insert hook in next st yo and pull up a loop yo and draw through 2 loops on hook yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook row 2 chain 3 turn counts as 1st double_crochet double_crochet in next st not the same as the chain 3 chain 1 work cluster chain 1 across double_crochet in last st the top of the chain 3 from row 1 **note** the skipped stitch when working the cluster is the chain 1 from the previous row row 3 chain 3 turn counts as 1st double_crochet work cluster chain 1 across double_crochet in last st the top of the chain 3 from row 1 repeat row 3 till desired length optional lacey edging chain 3 turn slip_stitch in next cluster stitch chain 3 across to the last stitch slip_stitch in the top of chain 3 of the previous row finish off sew buttons on even with buttonholes on opposite side of chest for ribbon straps cut 4 lengths of ribbon 7 8 9 10 11 12 inches each insert ribbon through the tops of the marked stitches sew ribbon in place cut a 4 piece of ribbon tie in a bow and sew to the center front of the tank right where the half_double_crochet row end and the v_stitch row begin for crocheted straps using crochet thread and f hook join with slip_stitch in marked stitch chain till strap measures 7 8 9 10 11 12 inches finish off repeat for all marked stitches chain a 4 chain tie in a bow and sew to front center of the tank right where the half_double_crochet row end and the cluster stitch row begin terminology abbreviation full term yo yarn over single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain st sts stitch stitches copyright © 2006 by patti gonsalves all rights reserved this pattern is for the personal use of the
